title: Cognitive Map-Based Project Training for Advanced Online Mathematics Learning Design and Implementation

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic math concepts and proficiency with fundamental digital tools
context.additional_context: Learner role: Office/administrative working professionals, Domain expertise: Advanced, Assessment method: Project outcome-based, Technical environment: Tablet/laptop provided.

learning_goals: Learners can visualize and optimize mathematical problem-solving processes using cognitive mapping techniques.
Learners can design and execute complex mathematical modeling projects using online simulation tools.
Learners develop practical mathematical solutions applicable to real-world tasks through iterative improvements via peer feedback in a PBL environment.
Learners understand technology acceptance model (TAM)-based design and strengthen self-efficacy toward online learning systems.

resources: Online Learning Platforms (Zoom/Teams), Collaborative Tools (Miro/Coggle), Simulation Software (MATLAB/GeoGebra)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
